moves.2. d4: but i'm not going to play too bad an opening
moves.3... c5: a strong move to strenghten his attck and weaken my defence and it takes more control of the centre of the board
moves.6. Be2: i need to make my bishop reach a strong position
moves.7. dxc5: i don't mind now that i am better defended
moves.9... a6: oh no- he wants a swap off
moves.12. axb4: i can now get in the lead
moves.13. Bd2: but that was obviously going to keep me in the lead
moves.14... Bd7: the bishop makes its way into the game
moves.15. Qxb7: but that was a proper blunder or was it?
moves.18. Qxf7+: but that was a mistake on black's part
moves.18... Rfxf7: i can get that queen now and...
moves.20. O-O: i need to get my king to safety
moves.21. Bxc4: bishop is threatening to pin that rook on f7
moves.23. Ne5#: didn't see that CHECKMATE coming. Note that Ng5 is not mate. It turns out that opening was rather successful for me or was it the fact that i only won because of some careless blunders on black's part! yay for me though!

gameName: a weird opening to get success with!
